edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces

Interface ActorInterface


  • public interface ActorInterface
    This interface provides the ability to add methods to Actor, without modifying code in the engine, or downcasting references in the game.
    Author:
    Kee Pei Jiin, Tan Wei Li

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Check if the actor is aiming at a target

    • Method Detail

      • maxHitPoints

        int maxHitPoints()
        Getter for maximum hit point of actor
        Returns:
        An integer representing the maximum hit point of the actor

      • hitPoints

        int hitPoints()
        Getter for current hit point of actor
        Returns:
        An integer representing the current hit point of the actor

      • takeDamage

        java.lang.String takeDamage(int points,
                            edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor otherActor,
                            edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map)
        Actor takes the damage, i.e. health point is deducted by the damage value of the weapon used in attack
        Parameters:
        points - number of hitpoints to deduct.
        otherActor - The other actor performing the attack action to the current actor.
        map - The map the other actor attacking the current actor is on.
        Returns:
        A string that describes the damage taken by target, e.g. "Zombie drops an arm"

      • aimingAtTarget

        java.lang.Boolean aimingAtTarget()
        Check if the actor is aiming at a target
        Returns:
        a boolean which indicates if the actor is aiming at a target.

      • setAimingAtTarget

        void setAimingAtTarget(java.lang.Boolean aim)
        Set the actor to indicate that it is aiming at a target or not
        Parameters:
        aim - a boolean attribute to be set to actor's attribute to indicate if it is aiming at target or not

      • getAmmunitionBoxInInventory

        default game.AmmunitionBox getAmmunitionBoxInInventory()
        Get the first ammunition box in actor inventory if there is any. By default, this method returns null.
        Returns:
        the first ammunition box in actor inventory if there is any, otherwise return null
